column4: Greetings.  Is ubuntu (livecd) able to boot the underlying OS, via some VM software?  The wife still need WinXX for iTunes..
you'd be better off running Frostwire in linux
thanks
let me google
agh!  wait.
my bad, i'm an idiot.  thought you said winMX, which is a filesharing client.
does she need itunes for the itunes store or ipod sync?
itunes store..
Starbucks give out free music weekly w/ her coffee..  :(
ah.  well, you could run windows through a VM inside ubuntu but you can't just boot the windows on your hard drive inside linux.
i've heard itunes works in Wine, but as far as I can tell that's a filthy lie.
Sure you can... w/ VMWare, but it's not on the ubuntu livecd.
ok..  sounds like I'm SOL w/ the livecd then?
if you tried that with VMware, i'm pretty sure there would be configuration issues from booting into virtualized/different hardware.  for instance?  activation.
kind of.  how adventurous are you feeling?
I don't want to hack VMWare, via a nfs share or anything like that, if that's what you're asking.  Too much *nix at work.  I just want it to work.
because if you had a flash drive, you could make an ubuntu live-USB stick with data persistence.  which'd let you install software, etc
ok, thanks for the sugguestions.  Would be a cool project if I had time..

i'm still not convinced that you can actually, you know, VMware the windows partition without the guest OS flipping out and going "whoa, all my hardware is different."  same reason you can't just pop a hard drive with XP into a different machine and expect it to boot.
it shouldn't be terribly time consuming.  if you google for ubuntu liveusb utility you should find a slick GUI tool to do all the heavy lifting for you.
